name: LPJmL crop yield forecasts
description: The model LPJmL (Lund-Potsdam-Jena with managed Land) is designed to simulate vegetation composition and distribution as well as stocks and land-atmosphere exchange flows of carbon, nitrogen, and water, for both natural and agricultural ecosystems. Using a combination of plant physiological relations, generalized empirically established functions and plant trait parameters, it simulates processes such as photosynthesis, plant growth, maintenance and regeneration losses, fire disturbance, soil moisture, runoff, evapotranspiration, irrigation and vegetation structure. LPJmL is currently the only DGVM that has dynamic land use fully incorporated at the global scale. The specific setup used here combines LPJmL version 5.3.001 with historical weather data from NASA Power, historical land use patterns, and historical nitrogen application rates, to provide global crop yield forecasts for 2021 and 2022. Since no weather forecasts are available until the end of 2022, historical weather data from NASA Power is used as historical analog to represent the range of possible weather in 2021 and 2022. All Forecasts start on July 16, 2021 and cover the whole globe except Antarctica. Results are preliminary and subject to the following CAVEATS: The model results have a spatial resolution of 0.5 by 0.5 degrees, approximately 55 by 55 km at the equator. The model explicitly simulates the effects of soil, weather, nitrogen, and irrigation status on crop yields at this spatial resolution. Other aspects of crop management such as pest control or planting density are not explicitly simulated, but are captured by a management factor that is calibrated on a country-by-country basis using country-level yield statistics from FAOSTAT. The simulations do not include multiple cropping systems such as several crops grown together on the same plot at the same time or crops harvested several times per year from the same plot. Only one growing season is simulated per crop in each grid cell. Potential effects of locusts or armed conflicts on agricultural production are not considered at all. Crop-specific growing areas are based on cropland patterns for 2017 since newer, spatially explicit information was not available. Crops harvested until July 15 2021 experience observed weather data for 2021. Crops sown in 2021 but harvested after July 15 2021, or sown and harvested in 2022 experience a range of weather forecasts starting on July 16 2021. Intervention scenarios aimed at higher fertilizer application rates or shifting sowing dates are only applied to crops sown after July 15 2021. Descriptions for inputs parameters provide information on further caveats.

maintainer.name: Sebastian Ostberg
maintainer.organization: Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research (PIK)

parameters.name: fertilizerscenario
parameters.description: The "reference" conditions represent global nitrogen application rates approximately in 2015. Chemical fertilizer rates are based on crop-specific spatial patterns from Mueller et al. (in: Nature, 2012), combined with historical trends for a few crop groups from Hurtt et al. (in:  Geosci. Model Dev., 2020). Manure application rates are based on Zhang et al. (in: Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 2017), but are limited to a maximum application rate of 100 kg/ha nitrogen from manure. The intervention scenarios add 25, 50, and 100 kg/ha additional nitrogen (chemical fertilizer) to crops sown after July 15 2021. CAVEATS: The dataset used to determine reference fertilizer application rates does not distinguish between different production systems (such as subsistence and high-input industrial farming) or between rainfed and irrigated crops. In areas with very low reference fertilizer application rates irrigated crop yields may not always be higher than rainfed crop yields due to nitrogen leaching by irrigation water. Leguminous crops (soybean) do not experience nitrogen limitation in the current model version and are therefore not expected to respond to increases in fertilizer application.
parameters.unit_description: kilograms per hectare of additional nitrogen fertilizer

parameters.name: sowingscenario
parameters.description: Sowing dates under reference conditions are based on a new global crop calendar dataset produced within the global gridded crop model intercomparison (GGCMI) Phase 3. Intervention scenarios shift sowing dates by minus or plus 15 or 30 days. Sowing dates are only shifted for crops sown after July 15 2021, and not at all for sugar cane.
parameters.unit_description: Offset of sowing date in days

parameters.name: weatheryear
parameters.description: Observed weather data from 2021 is used for the period of January 1 to July 15 2021. All weather forecasts start on July 16 2021 and run until December 31st 2022. Select historical weather years to use as analog for the weather forecast. Note: We suggest to always simulate all weather years to get an estimate of uncertainty of crop production. CAVEATS: Future weather cannot be expected to resemble any particular historical year exactly. Due to changes in crop growing patterns and fertilizer application rates we do not expect the forecast crop production under a specific weather year to equal the historical crop production achieved during that year.
parameters.unit_description: historical weather data used as analog for forecast

outputs.name: harvested_area
outputs.description: area from which the crop was harvested

outputs.name: crop_yield
outputs.description: harvested biomass, expressed as dry matter

outputs.name: crop_production
outputs.description: crop production, expressed as dry matter

outputs.name: irrigation_water
outputs.description: irrigation water applied to crop per growing season; does not include transport losses. always 0 for rainfed crops, applies only to irrigated crops.
outputs.unit_description: millimeters of irrigation water per growing season

qualifier_outputs.name: admin1
qualifier_outputs.description: coordinates of the center of grid cell

qualifier_outputs.name: admin2
qualifier_outputs.description: coordinates of the center of grid cell

qualifier_outputs.name: admin3
qualifier_outputs.description: coordinates of the center of grid cell

qualifier_outputs.name: country
qualifier_outputs.description: coordinates of the center of grid cell

qualifier_outputs.name: lat
qualifier_outputs.description: coordinates of the center of grid cell

qualifier_outputs.name: lng
qualifier_outputs.description: coordinates of the center of grid cell

qualifier_outputs.name: NameIrrigation
qualifier_outputs.description: irrigation status: either "rainfed" (no irrigation) or "irrigated". irrigation demand is determined by the model based on soil moisture deficit.

qualifier_outputs.name: weather_year
qualifier_outputs.description: historical weather analog used for forecast.
